channel.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
channel.description:
My first game that i have played in my life was Half-life and until today i play it.... sometimes...it became my favourite game and so i'm waiting with much expectations for the mod Black-Mesa....
What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?

item.source: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?

item.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
Uplink!

I remember loving this game but getting fustrated when I got cought and had to start all over (it saves your current status but you cant load to a previous point, i.e. only loads when you start up the game to your last point) because I didnt have enough time to clear the logs at x server.

Of course I only found out recently that I was doing it all wrong, you see if you use a server that you have easy access too as the first bounce link (like InterNC) then if you dont have time to clear the logs, disconect and go to this server and clear the bounding logs effectibly denying a trace to your ip.

Also the fact the latest patch introduces the future to save your bounced servers config, so you dont have to manually click tens of servers everytime you want to hack makes it incredibly less annoying.

So yeah actually getting somewhere in the storyline this time around and loving it!

PS: It´s on steam for 10€ well worth it

Read full topic

item.source: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?

item.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
RED@KTOR:

If i’t a PC game, then it’s Dangerous Dave.

Dangerous Dave and the Haunted Mansion for MS-DOS was cool.

You kids who started out playing Halo and Half Life as your first games don’t know what you were missing. A lot of my earliest games were first played on MS-DOS/Windows; Snake, Dangerous Dave and the Haunted Mansion, Chip’s Challenge, Ski Free, Stellar7, Prince of Persia, Wolfenstein 3D, and Chex Quest. Those were good times.

Read full topic

item.description:
bigfan421:

That’s Probably “zombies Ate my Neighbors”

Strangely enough, that’s not the game I have in mind. It was more like a 2D platformer for PC. And if I remember correctly, the final boss was some kind of evil clone of the kid you’re playing as.

item.source: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?

item.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
item.dc:creator: p.columbo
item.description:
Oh man, I’ve played so many different videogames when I was a kid. I can’t even tell which one was the first. I even recall watching my father playing videogames stored on some kind of cassette tape (Commodore 64 maybe?). But the ones I remember the most are Albion, Prehistorik (2?), some kind of brick breaker game, Doom 2, Jazz Jackrabbit and some game with a kid running around graveyards killing zombies and monsters with a slingshot. I completely forgot the name of that game.

Edit: But I must admit I rarely finished any videogame and when it was possible I played using cheats and walkthroughs. I think the first game I played all the way through and without cheating was Half-Life 2.

Read full topic

item.source: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?

item.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
I can’t, for the life of me, remember the name of this game, but it was an edutainment Sesame Street Alphabet game that had a merry-go-round with Cookie Monster picking out letters to form words. This game utilized the function keys to their fullest extent with an overlay that went over them that worked towards specific actions in the game.

That’s about all I remember, but it was the first game I played, and it was on an MS-DOS computer.

Read full topic

item.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
item.dc:creator: xrufix
item.description:
Hide and Seek, i guess. haha.

There was a helicopter combat simulation, named somewhat like “Longbow”. But when my mother saw me shooting those 2d peeps (although the game was 3d), i wasnt allowed to play it again. (I think this was in 1996 when i was 6 years old)

item.title: What was your first Game that you had played in your Life?
item.dc:creator: _amp_8706_lpha
item.description:
Hmmm… It was out of Doom and Quake for PC which led to Hexen and Duke3D then to Unreal and Half-Life.

For PS1 it was Spyro the Dragon 2: Gateway to Glimmer and Gran Turismo 2

…But I guess if you include the Sega Megadrive, the first ever game I played was out of Sonic the Hedgehog or Two Crude Dudes.

Read full topic
